text: A referendum on the initiatives of King Norodom Sihanouk at the Geneva Conference was held in Cambodia on 7 February 1955. It was approved by 99.8% of voters.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, p68 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Choice !Votes !% |- |align=left|For||925,667||99.8 |- |align=left|Against||1,834||0.2 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes|| ||– |- |align=left|Total||927,501||100 |- |colspan=3 align=left|Source: Nohlen et al. |} ==References== Category:Referendums in Cambodia Geneva Conference referendum Cambodia
title: 1955 Cambodian Geneva Conference referendum
